Guess you're missing Andres point here.  This is a message board, NOT an
advertising board. You posted your message once, everyone would have seen
it, you did your job. You have plenty of other venues to peddle this dvd.
Unfortunately, THIS place isn't it.
THAT was the point Andres was trying to make.

Just got John Yumoto's "The Samurai Sword" in the mail yesterday!  Any
sugestions out there for a must have "second" reference book? Just keeping
things basic at this point. Not specializing in any one specific area yet.
Has anyone read "The Connoisseur's Book of Japoanese Swords"?

Mark

  -----Original Message-----
  From: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com [mailto:nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com]On
Behalf Of ritchey sealy
  Sent: Thursday, August 04, 2005 4:23 AM
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] new release dvd


  then you will miss out this  a very high standard dvd iv seen a lot on the
market an this one beats them all as far as practical info goes  but thanks
for the suggestion iv seen it you havent

  Andres Pedraza <apedraza@...> wrote:This looks to be the
same link posted a day or two ago. I think we
  get the message. As a suggestion, if you continue plugging it via
  daily email, you'll find that even the few here who might have bought
  it will no longer do so, just out of disapproval of the advertising
  tactics used.

  Regards,

  Andres
